Hi!

This problem commed on Gentoo Linux, Gnome, GTK.

I'm getting the following Exception, when I'm trying to run the hello world SWT application.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no swt-pi-gtk-3139 in java.library.path
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1682)
	at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:822)
	at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:992)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:123)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS.<clinit>(OS.java:19)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Converter.wcsToMbcs(Converter.java:63)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Converter.wcsToMbcs(Converter.java:54)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.<clinit>(Display.java:122)
	at org.cookbook.ch08.FirstSWTClass.main(FirstSWTClass.java:15)

I've followed the book, and configured the SWT jar file (org.eclipse.swt.gtk.linux.x86_3.1.1.jar) found in eclipse plugin directory to use in the java.library.path varriable, but didn't help. Also download SUN JRE 1.5, but didn't fix it (read this solution else where on the internet).

What did help, that copied out the "so" files from this jar into a directory and configured that for java.library.path.

Than other issues come up, that if I'm using my application with different swt.jars it requires different gtk-s. If I'm using, with the jar comming from eclipse it requires gtk-3139. I've downloaded swt 3.1-r1, with gentoo emerge command. If I set this file in the classpath varriable, than it requires gtk-3138. I was only able to solve this problem by creating soft links on the 3139 files, with 3138 links.

So this means, that different SWT packages requires different libaries, or environment.

I don't know that this is really a bug , because it isn't miss behaving and the whole problem is commed from my bad knowlege about GTK. But I want to report it, because others might meet this problemto and I wasn't able to locate solution on the internet for this issue. Other thing is, that it violates platform independency a little and I don't want to write down public, but I've made a record in required time creating a Hello World application, which I think never going to be beeten :). (Hello CORBA was easier :) )

There is FAQ item about this:
http://www.eclipse.org/swt/faq.php#missingdll

I just updated to it.
